job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Nashville, TN
pros: I really enjoyed the people that I worked with. I enjoyed coming to work every day. Every single one of my co-workers took pride in their work, and genuinely cares about each employee, their families, and the community they serve. I enjoyed coming to work each day.
cons: On the good side, people stay in this department for a very long time because it is a great place to work. But it seems like that makes it hard to advance.

pros: Small town hospital with good commute time.
cons: Understaffed! Staff is stressed and cranky.

review_title: Worked as a tech before pandemic
pros: My supervisors were understanding of my schedule, since I was working part-time while going to school. I was able to get good experience before going to nursing school. In general, my co-workers were kind and easy to work with! The job is hard, but we did our best to help each other out.
cons: The training was minimal, to say the least! I had to ask a lot of questions to figure out how things worked on my unit. I was definitely "thrown in" because they were desperate for staff but I was able to adapt fast.

pros: Great teamwork, friendly staff, and nice facility.
cons: Paid is low for the workload and market.

pros: This facility tried to make it a great place to work. The pandemic hurt the atmosphere a lot which is why I left. I would probably work there again in the future.
cons: It’s a hospital and like every single hospital in the nation they are in a staffing crisis with high nurse to patient ratios.

pros: Great place to work. It has a family feel. The hospital is big enough that we are doing really innovative work but small enough that the individual employee still matters. It feels like home.

review_title: Do Not work here during the Pandemic
pros: Parking is free and located close, and great teamwork.
cons: WMC will not pay you if you are sick with CoVid, if you are out of work and have no PTO you will not be compensated. currently not giving raises in 2021, freezing taking PTO, and just enforced mandatory overtime .

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Franklin, TN
pros: Completely turned off to this hospital
cons: The doctors and employees I worked with are lazy, ignorant, dont do their jobs and dont care about patients. I had a good friend of mine get in a bad car wreck and he came to williamson here to get help and care but no one helped him no doctor would give him mri or find out whats wrong  fresh from a car accident and was in pain from his neck to his knee with already a neck injury in the past it was dangerous grounds to get hurt he got hit hard ..that is where your suppose to get care well no one did. doctor told him he cant give him mri and there is nothing they can do for him. He was blown off and left in pain. After seeing that and a few other things before I no longer can work for a hospital that are scum bags with no common sense. You cannot operate this way it is called a hospital for a reason. They do not care at all  they get paid to do nothing its pathetic.

job_title: Retired Critical Care RN in Franklin, TN
pros: Small hospital feel, yet has nearly everything a larger hospital has. Excellent nurses and the Doctors have a good bedside manner, and a good many of them did their residency at Vanderbilt, a highly reputable University.  Excellent food. A lot of people from out in the community come here to eat Sunday dinner and breakfast.  The cleanest hospital around. Convenient parking.
cons: If you need a coronary artery bypass surgery, you will have to go downtown. Can't think of anything else.

pros: Work/Life balance is good.  Enjoyable coworkers and a good respectful patient population.  Most physicians are competent in their specified field.  Most of the physicians are respectful to both the patients and nurses.
cons: Good old boys club is the name of this place.  Managers are puppets to the money hungry upper business management.  Not for profit results in big bonuses for managers who keep staffing at a skeleton crew.  Be ready to work like a dog so these folks can enjoy their kick backs.  Managers are puppets to bully nurses and higher ups.

pros: Williamson Medical is very close to my house, the staff is very friendly everywhere, and my managers are very open to working around my schedule.
cons: Unfortunately, the pay at Williamson is a lot less than many other hospitals I make less now than I made starting out at the same job at another hospital a year ago.  Management on my floor also seems to understaff a lot

pros: great place to work, benefits are top notch, coworkers are friendly and encouraging, A1 service and hospitality to patients, It was more about the patients and not the money there, Probably worked for the best and most caring Rehab Director to his staff, PTO build up is amazing
cons: the pay as a tech was subpar for the workload compared to everywhere else, assisting with patients all day really took a toll on my body, Some coworkers can make you feel below them at times,

pros: Unit was well stocked with amenities for the patients.  Plenty of training.  Medical benefits good. Easy access to parking.
cons: Low pay, community hospital, so they roll the carpets up at 5 pm and tuck everyone in; in other words, don't bother the physicians about their patients at night. Nurse to patient ratios too high.  Triple charting is common.

pros: I'm awesome to work with.very dependable, quick to learn  team player. Honor to work for your organization. And very motivated. Love  helping others.
cons: Don't like negative situations. Dont like when people say there going to do a job and not getting  it done. Laziness ,not prepare to do the job.

pros: Great compared to some of the other hospitals I've worked for. A lot more relaxed and more of a family environment. They make an effort to show their employees appreciation.
cons: I have noticed that Williamson tends to pay slightly less than most other hospitals.
